reviewText: My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through. I agreed. At 28
date: I have never touched a cigarette. I must say
recommended: I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it
hoursPlayed: because this game gave me cancer anyway.\n\n"

reviewText: It's one of those" games. Since i barely had an expericne
date:
i'm just going to make a pro and con list.

Pros

Cons

-very few servers
-pay to win. Since the good weapons that do high damage cost "tokens"
-poorly made interface
-very slow paced gameplay
-bootleg soundtracks (Maple story
recommended: etc)\n-mentally undeveloped children as community\n-no objectives other than Build
hoursPlayed:
TDM and Zombie Mode
-no character customisation if you don't want to spend money
-no rewards for winning or killing enemies
-no fun

An unentertaining waste of time. Don't even bother checking it out."

reviewText:
Take it from every person that has commented, and me... Don't waste your time with this game. Just dont.

Things I didnt like
-Gameplay
-No Strategy involved whatsoever
-Pay to win
-5 yr olds playing
-Terrible audio
-Graphics are bad. Would much rather play Minecraft, or Call of Duty
-GUI was bad
-Menus were lame / unofficial
-WASTING MY TIME WITH THE GAME AND THIS REVIEW

Things I DID like
-Theres an un-install button
-Thats about it...

In the end, its a FANTASTIC game if your just learning your alphabet.
Mix between Call of Duty and Minecraft? No.
Mix between Roblox and Candyland? YES!
If you are reading this, and like the game, I've lost all respect for you.
I'd rather go play Chutes and Ladders than sit here and waste my time.

Recommend? NO
Dont even bother installing the game. I installed for gags cause I was reading all of the other comments, wanted to see for myself how bad it was and to laugh. Didnt laugh. Just dissapointed in myself for installing it.

reviewText:
-Have heard of Brick force

-Thought that was a cool minecraft-like game

-Watched the Steam page, thought that was cool

-Seen the evaluations

-Evaluations were pretty bad, but thought that they were fools

-Downloaded the game for 3 minutes

-Launched

-I already had an account but this ♥♥♥♥♥♥ menu wanted me to create an account

-Don't liked my username

-No updates or patches, the launcher launch the game

-A tutorial launches but i don't want to do it

-Go to main menu, and force me to get to the tutorial

-Did it

-Gone to the shop, thought that was my inventory and that i had such things, Seen that was already a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ P2W

-Playing on a custom de_dust2 map

-French voices are ♥♥♥♥♥♥

-Died

-♥♥♥♥♥♥ controls embarassed me

-Wanted to play the build mode

-Forces me to another tutorial

-Go to a random server

-Can't build anything

-The game had ♥♥♥♥♥♥ graphics and turns on 3fps,60fps,3fps,60fps...

-Quit the game

-Go to the desktop

-Open steam

-Uninstalled

Best Uninstalling & Waste of time Simulator 20/20

reviewText:
I was first introduced to this game by my brother (CrispyMarshmellows) back in... 2012 I think. I liked what I saw, it was the first FPS I ever really played and you know, I had fun. But one day I stopped playing (probably the day I discovered TF2) and didn't return to it ever again. But then one parculiar day in 2015, three years later, I see the game has had a Steam release. I decided this was the time to give it a second chance.

Now before I continue, I'd like to point out that I've played Team Fortress 2 A LOT. 2,072 hours and continuing to climb. I am fully aware that this is not a class-based shooter and therefore won't compare Brick Force's structure to TF2's Structure because class based gameplay is not what this game is going for. It's going for something comparable to CoD (oh lord...) thrown in a rusty blender with Minecraft.

Story:
What's that? There isn't one?   ...ok then... Allow me to make up some bullsh*t for you:
Brick Mannly stole Sir Brickenstein's lawnmower one day so Brickenstein gathered some friends to go to kick Mannly's ♥♥♥ and take back the lawnmower. In retaliation, Mannly gathered his friends to go kick Brickenstein's ♥♥♥ even harder and keep his prized lawnmower. This developed into a global war because this world's population is are a bunch of overzealous dunces.

Gameplay:
Oh sweet lord the gameplay, Back on track with my story.
I started up the game to be greeted by a message to make a Brick-Force profile... Hmm" I asked myself. "Why can't I just use my Steam profile?" I asked again. I did as told and proceeded to a mandatory tutorial. It was here I started noticing somewhat problematic issues. My feild of view (FOV) was set to what
date: 30? I wanted to change it. I was shocked to find that I couldn't. In a first person shooter
recommended: that's a huge red flag. I continued without many issues regarding control. The game didn't crash at all either
hoursPlayed: something I see others mention alot. I must just be lucky.\n\nAnyway
voteText: Once done
helpfulPercent: I jumped into a game on a map featuring floating islands. The blue base situated on a lonely floating island where as red base was a castle turret. You see the issue right? Map balance seems non existant here. In team deathmatch
votesHelpful: this gives red a huge defense advantage over blue. So much is wrong with that kind of map design
votesTotal: Any TF2 player will tell you that map designers. Onwards with the story
votesFunny: I left blue spawn to find red mercilessly camping our one and only tiny exit door. I facepalm hard enough to leave a mark on my forehead and leave the game. I join another
commentsCount: on a bridge map of some description. The map balance was much better here though. Both sides looked roughly the same. Delighted
column16: I carried on towards horrendous death. I foundmyself blindsighted one too many times however. Oh boy
column17: isn't this FOV just WONDERFUL?\n\nI spent a bit of time before remembering one thing about this game. The ♥♥♥♥ing pay-to-win model. The stock weapons you have are a horrendous AK-47 and a crappy little peashooter that looks like a pistol. At this point the game says: "Oh do you not like my very balanced stock weapons? You want better things? Well why not buy them from the store with real money!" The realisation came fast and I was appauled. This game was pay-to-win. Various clothing you can buy exists as well in a manor something like TF2. But unlike that certain good game
column18: These things gave you advantages over the competition. I simply shook my head
column19:
closed the game and uninstalled it.

Graphics:
The game looks alright enough but one key issue was that some pinhead on the dev team cranked the gamma level up way too high. The game is a visual eyesore with no actual lighting. Like Minecraft Indev except... ♥♥♥♥♥ier.

Sound:
As far as I'm aware the game has no music. If it does it didn't work for me. As for actual sound direction the weapons make good enough sounds when using them. But there's no hitsound. That is a standard thing for this genre. To know when you've hit someone and how much damage you did is crucial to planning your moves. Even CoD has a hitsound. And for the record
column20: TF2 might not START with a hitsound but you can head into the advanced options and turn it on at least.\nOne last thing. Whenever you get a kill
column21:
you hear the most obnoxious little sounds these guys call voice acting.

The Verdict:
Stay far away from this game. There are so many other
column22: better games both in the FPS genre and  in the sandbox genre. I'd say only poke this game with your ten foot pole when you require a dead horse to beat. Even then
column23: Internet Explorer is better for dead-horse beating."

reviewText:
BEST CRASH SIMULATOR 2014 10/10

Now is the time to talk seriously, I have played this game many times before it came out on steam, every time the process was this: install , plays an hour, uninstall. Why? Easy, this game doesn't offer anything to a gamer. Let me explain the gameplay: hide in the blocks, don't move, kill people. This game is boring, isn't competitive, isn't funny to play, this game is nothing. You now have two choices: Buy permanent weapons with money of game and wasting 2 months on this game or sell your parents and buy the defintive pro weapons.

Nice idea, horrible realization, just another useless p2w shooter. There are games with this style much more beautiful and fun from 5€ to 10€, and I think it's better than spend 40€ for a weapon and a pair of panties.

reviewText:
I should accuse Exe Games Inc. for promoting cyber-bullying, because this game is just disgusting.

Brick-Force is Free to play, and that's all it is worth- but the Downloadable Content is incredibly overpriced (not that anyone is even going to purchase it anyway.) I haven't even played this game for that long but I'm almost certain that there are hidden microtransactions somewhere.

How can the developers be proud to have a game like this available to the public?
The fact is that they just don't care. They only care about the money in their pockets.
We already have one Electronic Arts™ and we most certainly do not need another.
If this game wasn't just a poor attempt at getting money from the Call of Duty x Minecraft hype then Exe Games Inc. might've actually developed something decent.

This game doesn't even come close to Minecraft or Call of Duty. In fact the only way that this game could be considered a baby" of CoD and MC is if that baby was dropped on it's head
recommended: and possibly in-bred.\n\nI don't recommend this game to anyone except for little children who can't play decent games. Let those kids reside here

With it's truly uninspirational design, I've had so many ideas on how I could make my own game!  How should I make my own game, you ask? Simple!
You need to follow these simple steps:
1. Put in plenty of completely orignal ideas people will like! Eg. Call of Duty x Minecraft. That's creative, eh?
2. Add overpriced DLC along with just pointless microtransactions nobody will buy!
3. An ingame store, which costs a second currency, which you need to buy with real money!
4. Have the items you just bought only last a week!
5. Make the game use ♥♥♥♥ tons of ram, and still lag like ♥♥♥♥ and run at approximately 20 fps!
6. Never update the game since release!
7. Make sure there are no Australian, Asian, or African servers! That'd be a ♥♥♥♥ing waste of money, even though it does cost $50 to get 1000 in game credits! As if $50 would be enough to keep even a simple server going.
and last, but not least,
8. Have the most ♥♥♥♥ing input lag you could imagine into the game. Perhaps, a second or two of input lag. Mix that in a brew with 20fps, and you've got yourself a darn fine optimization scheme there.

All 8 of these are crucial when it comes to game design. But there are a few things I didn't mention. For example, a really bad colour scheme between friendlies and enemies, and another thing which is important, make sure the graphics make no sense with the type of game you're trying to make.

Mix all 8 of those things, and you'll be sure to rake in plenty of dough in no time! Thanks for reading. I hope this educated you on why the this game is so very ♥♥♥♥, and that you should download, wait for the cards, then leave.

reviewText:
I don't understand why people hate on this game so much, I think its pretty good.

For starters, I really enjoyed the amount of time I spent at the loading screen. It really built suspense for the game and heightened my excitement. Too many games nowadays just blaze through the load screen and it just kills the game for me.

I found the tutorial to be very helpful and necessary. Other computer games I play use a similar WASD configuration, but it feels *really* different for some reason on this game and was very worthy of explanation. It was also really important that the tutorial told us that the space key was jump - it would have taken me forever to figure that out. No other game that I've ever played uses the space key for jumping for some reason, even though it is a very large and very hittable key and it just feels really intuitive, so I hope other game developers take note.

Several times during the tutorial, I found myself being randomly disconnected on the server. This is by far the best feature in the game. Other games, like Team Fortress 2, waste several seconds waiting and determining if you are disconnected from the server. The problem though is I'm not a patient gamer - if there is even a nanosecond when I am not actually connected to the server, I want to know about it, and I want to be kicked off immediately. I don't want to give the enemy the satisfaction of being able to shoot me while I can't get away. Better yet, while in the tutorial, a disconnect from server meant re-starting the whole game. Who doesn't like starting fresh?

I feel so honored to be able to play with 10-year old MLGs. Its not everyday you come across so many people who have so much skill at such a young age. And my weapons? Its great that they disappear so quickly... I always hated cleaning out my TF2 backpack. Now I can spend loads of time earning money to spend on weapons only to have them disappear on me - I love it.

Maybe one thing I didn't really like about the game was how easy it was to accidentally hit the uninstall button. If this issue is fixed, I will give you the rating you deserve.*

*Warning: No numeric value currently known to mankind can accurately represent how *great* this game is.

reviewText:
Normally I don't write reviews, but I felt compelled to write one for Brick-Force because of the way the game changed after beta was over.


I found Brick-Force while browsing around back in 2012. Back then it was in its closed beta form, and looked very promising. I received my key to enter the game and I couldn't wait to play! I had an amazing time on BF and for a very long time it was the only game I played consistently day-to-day. I actually still have the playlist on Spotify that I used to listen to while playing BF. I play it sometimes just for the nostalgia.

Don't get me wrong, beta-BF had its problems, mainly lack of content and rented guns. The biggest deal for me was the complete lack of 'pay to win' in the game. The lack of content was no biggy (it was closed beta, so it was to be expected). If one played often getting guns was no issue at all. I believe that guns were rented on a weekly or monthly basis, with monthly being a better deal. I personally don't have an issue with guns being rented out, as it makes testing a gun before buying it long-term a much easier task.

So, I played BF and had a good time, then beta ended. The update came immediately after. This update cast a dark shadow over the citizens of BF. It brought forth a cash shop with weapons purchasable only with premium currency. These weapons were so ridiculously overpowered that even the most talented players on the game, including myself, couldn't compete. You cannot simply kill someone that has a rocket or a grenade launcher when you only have a rifle.

TL;DR Brick-Force was a balanced game with a friendly community before the final release, which turned it into a steaming pile of garbage.

IMPORTANT NOTE: I haven't played this game since witnessing the pay to win model I saw at final release. From the other reviews I've read I don't think it's changed much.

This is how the brick force died.

reviewText:
Please note that this is a single person's opinion on this game, and only facts and opinion will be stated


Please note that I played this game back in 2012 for around a minimum of 90 total hours.

Now that we got that out of the way lets dive into this addictive mess.

Brick force lets you build, publish and play your own maps and everyone ells maps, these are mostly setup with square blocks and some decorations, you can build everything that comes to mind and publish it for everyone ells to play and rate, once you do that you can make your map free or set up a price for others to download you're stage, then you join or create a waiting room and start shooting at each other for exp, cash and so on in different game modes.

Build:
The building aspect lets you build anything that comes to mind into a map with limits such as the block and decoration theme packs being sold for real money and the limit on each block or decoration type placed on the map, people can then rate and report your published map.

Share:
This is where your finished map ends up and where most people feel cheated, to publish your map you must pay a one time fee, this would be perfectly fine if that fee wasn't so expensive and required many hours of play time to earn for non paying players, In basic: the larger and more detailed your map is the more you will have to pay.

PS: If your map contains any errors you will have to pay the full price again to edit it if already published.

Play:
You joined a match and are playing and having fun, but every now and then there is this player that your team just can't seem to kill no matter what and that always takes the first place after every match. That is a pay to win player, everything from weapons to cosmetics and even small boost items like gems, auto reload, radar and health potions can be brought from the cash shop.
A few of these cash shop items can be brought for in-game cash but here is the trick, every item being pay to win or earned is timed, so if you wish to stay as non paying player you will find you're self in a constant race against time, because you will not" use the free permanent weapons that comes with every created account cause they will literally make your enemies feel like sponges as they slowly turn around and kill you with a couple of bullets.

PS: You can buy permanent weapons and cosmetics cheap if you pay money
date:
if you wish to stay as a non-paying player you will need huge amounts of in game cash.

Verdict:
Fun semi addictive game that tries to appeal to a younger audience who want's to shot and have fun.
It however fails at much more like the heavy pay to win features and the somehow backwards mechanics working against the game and players
recommended: as in if you create a map (content for the game) you also have to pay in order to publish that map
hoursPlayed: just imagine all the great maps that will never see the day of light because of this feature."

reviewText:
I've had an account since closed beta and most of the issues I am about to list have been prevalent since day one because Infernum are a terrible developer who do not give a ♥♥♥♥ about the quality of their own game or their consumers. Let's list some of the highlights you can expect to encounter if you play this game:


-Brick-Force EU is filled with people who have googled hacks and will fly around the map with god mode and aim bots using an external client, so on the rare case they do get banned, they can just make another account without any consequences. There is no admin control for these people, the only way to get them out of your game is via a kick vote Brick-Force players will be too stupid to press, then when the vote fails these players will continue to hack with no possibility of being removed from the game.

-The game is extremely P2W. Money will buy you weapons that are statistically better than anything that is obtainable through other means, money will also obtain you extra armor, and armor in general which basically translates to extra hit points that other players wont have."

-Players will buy consumables that stop them from dying in a fight. At higher levels
date: expect to run into people who are not only fully geared out with the above advantages
recommended: but also players who when you get their health down press a button and heal themselves to stop you from killing them. They will do this again and again and again and they will continuously top the score board.\n\n-This game has no skill to its combat. Everyone moves extremely slowly
hoursPlayed: has a ridiculously large hit box
voteText: and a fight is determined by whoever held down the trigger first on the most P2W assault rifle. In these encounters there is nothing you can do to avoid losing
helpfulPercent: no tactical use of cover since taking shots will slow you down
votesHelpful: no maneuvers or alternative gear to counter spray and pray tactics
votesTotal:
just two people with assault rifles holding the trigger. Thats it. Thats all you can do.

-This game doesn't even have air control. When you jump or get launched by a jump pad your movement is fixated in the direction you were moving when you travelled through the air.

-Support is notoriously bad. Recently Infernum shut down their US servers because they killed off their player base so every US player had to have their items transferred to the EU servers with higher ping and hacker problems. Players were only allowed to choose 3 items in their inventory to transfer over along with a compensatory amount of premium currency because Infernum are lazy and dont give a ♥♥♥♥ about their consumers. I got one of the faster responses which took them almost a month to transfer 3 guns to a new account
votesFunny: which had no XP so goodbye exclusive items and the ability to re-obtain gear I previously owned. Meanwhile I have friends who sent their support a message regarding the transfer who almost a month down the line still haven't recieved a response.\n\nOn any other issue they are even worse
commentsCount: they rarely check the forums
column16: especially the one on their own website
column17: and feedback is rarely ever implemented into the game. Even on occasions where a community manager or a developer has contacted me to say they would fix an issue (which almost never happens) it hasn't happened. So if you have a problem with the billions of hackers that populate every server amongst any of the other issues you will face
column19: Money and time would be better spent on a lobotomy as the effects of playing this for prolonged periods of time are probably worse on your mental health."

Overall this game is a 11/10 and a must download.

Simply due to the fact, that gameplay is dull, slow, and repetitive and broken all to hell. For example, one of my biggest hates is everyone's buying stuff! To make them 'mlg'. Its simply a pay to win game, after a while I get tired of seeing all of these pixel gun games, promising so much, and simply being a money grab.

All in all its dull, repetitive, slow, gameplay that brings nothing we haven't seen in the past, and its pay to win. So, don't fall victim to these heartless people, after all what do people want more than ever these days, 'Money'.

0/10

reviewText:
I played this game for a while, and i liked NOTHING about it.

Cons
-Community is dominated by 5-year-olds that believe they're ''MLG'' or something similar.
-Pay To Win... EVERYWHERE!!!
-Crashes constantly.
-Graphics are horrible.
-Overpriced DLC
-Gameplay itself is horrible, considering the movement and whatnot sucks. (The ladder mechanics... Just... NO.)
-''If Minecraft and COD had a baby, it'd come out deformed and p2w. And it'd be called ''Brickforce''.

Pros
-Uninstalls just fine


Do i reccomend this game?
NO.
As i said, it's p2w, and all the 5-year-olds scramble to raid their parents' wallets. And when they do...
''LOL IM SO GOOD!!!'' -PROCODPLAYERMLG
''No, you just bought a bunch of stuff.'' -MrGamePlayer
''NO U SUX LOL'' -PROCODPLAYERMLG
''I don't suck, it's just that you raided your parents' wallet to get all those items...'' -MrGamePlayer
''LOL NOOB U JEALOUS?'' -PROCODPLAYERMLG
''I'm not jealous of a 5-year-old''. -MrGamePlayer
PROCODPLAYERMLG Has Left The Game.

Bad Graphics, Made for kids, Horrible game mechanics...
See, If i want a GOOD game that ISN'T PAY-TO-WIN
I Can Head Over to the game that dominates this...
Team. Fortress. 2.
0/10. Don't install. It's just a waste of MegaBytes.
Bye.

reviewText:
I've been ignoring this game for a LOOONG time, i was gonna make a map for it, until i played more and more into the insanity as 8 year old Dorrito snorting mlg imitating FNAF DEGENERATES, and pay to win, i thought for a long time that roblox was a breeding ground for those things, sadly i think i found a new nest, if call of duty and minecraft had a baby, then i wouldn't bear to play with it, i suppose we should get on with the pros and cons eh?
(NOTIFICATION! I've played the entire game on KONGREGATE, So Ignore the time spent playing on this game!)
Pros:
-Creativity (if you consider building a corner barricade creative)
-Free to play! (like wizard 101, Pirate 101, Grand chase, elsword, maplestory, AND BLOODY STICKWARS!)


Cons:
-Kongregate had this on the website (i never wanna list this as a con EVER again, stuff like that bogs down the whole intention of steam)
-The kind of people playing it (just....just burn)
-controls
-Ign quote (this is just a personal opinion, but i had high hopes for this game, and then bring up kongregate...)
-pay to win (some people want you to pay SOME money, but thats done in ways that don't affect the game in anyway, aside from frying pan bragging rights)




Overall score: 3.6/10

reviewText: Now I can only say one thing about this game , like skyrim with guns..." .  Time for my real review this game makes me feel many things including nausea.  To begin one HUGE problem i had with this game is that the overall idea of this game is totally not original
date: but if they did take the concept of minecraft and Call of Duty smushing them together and did it well like Murder Miners.  Brick-Force also has another neat....ahem excuse me anoying as hell concept which is pay-to-win
recommended: which we all know the type so I digress to my next point.My first impressions of this game was it throwing me immediatly into a totorial giving me information i already knew like how to move and shoot ( any pc gamer should know this )
hoursPlayed: and giving me no feedback on anything I did.  No other game has made me feel more frustrated with the setting before
voteText: because there arent any that physically can function 'well'.  Theres no setting for FOV and your FOV default is probably 50.  The graphic setting arent any better because you have a slide bar that doesnt even effect how the game looks less of improves gamplay quality or speed.  While on the topic of settings

reviewText:
At first this game appears to be good particularly to those looking for a free version of ace of spades. You might even spend up to a few hours on this game. You then slowly discover that only half the blocks are available until you earn enough credits to unlock them (unless you want to hand over money. Then you realise that most of your fun so far has been griefing 7 year olds (sorry 7 year old mlg pro gamers) who are somehow addicted to this hellish mess of a game. You might purchase your first gun, and then discover its magically gone after three days (when will developers understand that renting guns is not a mechanic people like). You might also buy the wrong item for example a block placer might be called the best one but doesnt take into account another one. Finally having chosen you enjoy this game (if you do), the game will bug out, the security provider x-trap (useless software) will decide it cant function properly and the poorely manufactured game will simply break, normally by crashing on start up. Any developer support or help? No

overall if you are 7 years old, consider yourself a MLG superpro gamer who can 420 blaze it 360 noscope like a ninja and you are too hardcore to care about bugs, this is the game for you.

(for everything else theres mastercard.)

reviewText:
As a US F2P player that has played for 2 years now, they don't care about you. Only your money. I loved this game, I was able to overcome the paying players with hours of grinding and effort only for it to be taken away. And you get no compensation whatsoever for your hard work.

They shut down the Original & US-Servers and screwed everyone over that played for free, if you play the game and earned all your gear, you get nothing. They give you the middle finger and say no, only if you spend money do you get compensation. I already put a support ticket through once weeks ago, no response. I put another through today. They take away your levels and all your weapons and hours of commitment, and smile.

The proof is in their own post. I listed below the review.

I would not recommend this game to anyone that likes to play for fun and for free. As the game is far from fun as you hit Veteran, just people grinding the same map. Over and over, I used to do it too, it wasn't fun. Pay to win players with the best gear cheezing everything, it sucked but with time and effort I was able to fight back.

Not anymore, they took everything away. Everything I worked for is gone, oh but they'll help you if you spent money. They'll Compensate" you if you spent money. I'm done with this game
date: probably never gonna touch it again.\n\nI'm gonna go back to plaing Warframe
recommended: a good Free To Play game with a great model.\n\nGood luck all of you that plan to continue playing after being wiped
hoursPlayed:
I salute you. I cannot go on.




"What does it entail for North-American server players?

If you are currently in possession of a Brick-Force account on the US Server
voteText:
please be informed of the following:

We unfortunately can't offer existing US server players a transfer of their account from the US server to the European server. We apologize for the inconvenience.

However
helpfulPercent: we will offer as much compensation as we can for your loss: you can contact our customer support and get reimbursed in Tokens for the value of any existing Tokens
votesHelpful: gear
votesTotal:
items or improvements you had bought on your US Server account.

Brick-Force US on Steam will close down as well. We are currently working on expanding territorial access of the Brick-Force EU Steam version to North-American residents in the near future."

TL;DR: Screw you if you spent no money and played for free
votesFunny: but we'll help if you spent money. Sorry."

reviewText: I... Really don't know how to describe how unbelievably bad this game is. The server's are laggy, everything is ugly, and it's a clear Call of Duty wannabe. The only way to get a new weapon (The first weapons suck) as far as I know, is buying it. Now that I think about it, it also seems to try to be CS:GO and Team Fortress 2 in the way you can buy more items for MONEY. However, TF2 does it the right way: you also get random items as you play through the game, but this attrocity? Nope. The only way to really see how bad this game is is by watching it or playing it - both are very unpleasant - because explaining this is just beyond my vocabulary... so WATCH IT. Don't play it, because the community may unwillingly give you brain cancer. Oops.

reviewText:
Not very good, It has a poorly made F2P model with weapons costing £8 or so worth of tokens and only lasting 7 days or so. Some weapons are permanent but they cost way to much for what they are worth as the player base is too limited and the game mode's don't really feel like anything special.

2/10

The Review:

The game has a number of game modes (Deathmatch, Team deathmatch, Capture the flag, Freefall which plays like Minecraft's Spleef"
date: Defend Which is a kind of PvE Tower Defence ish game mode
hoursPlayed: Zombie and Build 'n' Destroy). None of these game modes are anything new though and with the weapon's system just feels imbalanced and clunky.\n\nThe game has an overarching Free 2 Play model. You spend real world currency to buy 'Tokens' or you earn P points from playing matches. The weapons range in costs and cosmetic items generally are only buyable with tokens. The real kick to it though is almost everything has as timer when you purchase it
voteText: for example a gun could cost 6k p points for 7 days or 600 tokens for 7 days. This just creates a stupid paywall and inevitable money leech for some of the 'best' guns. Especially since some of the higher shotguns/rifles I saw are 16k p points...\n\nThe build mode also featured in the game isn't really anything to truly praise
helpfulPercent: it's not bad and it works for the most part but it's just a multiplayer map editor essentially. Which I guess can be interesting but if I were playing it for the building aspect I'd prefer to play something else.\n\nOverall I just can't really recommend it to anybody
votesHelpful: there are better block builders out there
votesTotal: there are better building games out there and there are better 'arena' style shooters out there. So I fail to really see who this is aimed at or what it is trying to be..."

reviewText: The First time i played i noticed the mouse movement was laggy, after a few minutes, it crashed out of nowhere. does not run very 'smoothly' at all. Don't see very much at all that's fun about this game. It seems to be aimed towards young children, as it is very clear that the guns, are not real guns, from the orange or green colored tip, shoot what seems to be paintballs, however the guns themselves do not look like a paintball gun. It seems to be trying to be a combo of Minecraft and call of duty, but does it very poorly. There is no Singleplayer. There is barely any people playing this game, and just an awful game overall. Not a good copy of Minecraft, Not a good Copy of Call of duty. If they start making people for this game, then anyone who buys it is not very wise. Try This Game at your own risk.

reviewText: This Game...\nThe graphics in this game are incredible. You will find yourself staring away into the beautiful landscapes of the maps. The gameplay is new and exciting, it will take hours of my life with its compelling and rewarding gameplay. The game is absolutley outstanding, but, there's one more thing... The story. The number of hours I have given to complete this game's 0.0 hour story is endless. My eyes dripped with tears and I was touched by the emotional adventure it took me through. No doubt, this should win game of the year and earns a special place in my heart. 10/10

reviewText:
Welcome to Brick Force, a game with  Friendly  angry players!

So Brick Force does have some good things
- Can be run on most computers
- Graphics are good  I guess
- Has a tutorial level
- Character customization
- A vote kick system

But like every game Brick Force does have it's downsides
- Main Menu is slightly confusing
- Everyone abuses the vote system
- Most players are aggressive
- Spawn Camping Heaven
- Some items only stay in your inventory for a few days

Some people  might  enjoy this game but download it and give it a try

Player's Favourite Words
- Noob
- Hacker
- Wallhacking
- Cheater
- *vote kick started*

reviewText:
This is a game called Brick-Force.

Advertised as CoD and Minecraft's baby"

So his father CoD was pretty lame. This game is no exception.

So we wrapped up the FPS part. let's get to Minecraft part.

You....place blocks.... OK!
And lack of players makes it even better.

CoD franchise was good at the beginning. Then developers got lazy and so on

Minecraft was a good game before mods and kids destroyed it. (Offline mode is still great!)

BUT THIS GAME It takes the "was good" part and skips to the part where it becomes unplayable.

My personal record of playtime: 17 minutes.

Have a good day."

reviewText:
It's not ENTIRELY pay to win, there are a good amount of weapons that you can buy without real money. Even though some weapons cost alot of in-game money to get permanently, when you buy a weapon, you have the option to choose how long you want it, you can get it permanently! (at a cost of pretty much all your in-game credits) Other than that, I don't have many other good things to say.

pro: what i said above

pro: it is easy to find games

pro: self pleasure when you're called a hacker

pro: other small pros

pro: people usually actually play all of the gamemodes, unlike other games where people only play team deathmatch

pro: over 3 pros

con: crossbow is almost overpowered, almost as strong as one of the best sniper rifles and costs as much as the cheapest one.

con: community turns it into a cancer simulator

con: your player looks like a bald American Dora the Explorer when your starting items wear off (your cool 7 day clothing you get when you start)

con: permanent clothing costs almost as much as a permanent gun

con: your weapon can run out of durability, and to repair it with in-game cash costs almost half as much as the actual gun costs (there goes your grinding efforts, you just screwed your gun up!, use all that money you grinded to repair it :D)

con: snipers are overpowered, as long as they see you they can shoot you, and yes they can see with their eyebrows, and the top of the head usually doesn't register bullets. But don't worry, since everyone is a newby (the older ones usually left the game), everyone usually has that sucky mp40 thing.

con: other small cons that many games have

9/11 would get shot by a sniper's eyebrow again

reviewText:
It's not ENTIRELY pay to win, there are a good amount of weapons that you can buy without real money. Even though some weapons cost alot of in-game money to get permanently, when you buy a weapon, you have the option to choose how long you want it, you can get it permanently! (at a cost of pretty much all your in-game credits) Other than that, I don't have many other good things to say.

pro: what i said above

pro: it is easy to find games

pro: self pleasure when you're called a hacker

pro: other small pros

pro: people usually actually play all of the gamemodes, unlike other games where people only play team deathmatch

pro: over 3 pros

con: crossbow is almost overpowered, almost as strong as one of the best sniper rifles and costs as much as the cheapest one.

con: community turns it into a cancer simulator

con: your player looks like a bald American Dora the Explorer when your starting items wear off (your cool 7 day clothing you get when you start)

con: permanent clothing costs almost as much as a permanent gun

con: your weapon can run out of durability, and to repair it with in-game cash costs almost half as much as the actual gun costs (there goes your grinding efforts, you just screwed your gun up!, use all that money you grinded to repair it :D)

con: snipers are overpowered, as long as they see you they can shoot you, and yes they can see with their eyebrows, and the top of the head usually doesn't register bullets. But don't worry, since everyone is a newby (the older ones usually left the game), everyone usually has that sucky mp40 thing.

con: other small cons that many games have

9/11 would get shot by a sniper's eyebrow again

reviewText:
Helpful game tutorial!

Step One: Download the game.
Step Two: Proceed through unhelpful, clunky tutorial.
Step Three: Join an online match.
Step Four: Get 'rekt' by 9 Y/O's with fully upgraded Sniper rifles.
Step Five: Press 'Alt+F4'
Step Six: Navigate to download folder.
Step Seven: Delete.

And that's it! You've experienced this game for all it is!

Overall rating:

Brick-Force content: -1/10
Uninstall button: 11/11 (Best part of the game itself! :D )

reviewText:
Product received for free

BUILD SHARE PLAY
I love the theme of Brick-Force. Like Minecraft and Cod combined, but with ROBLOX added in the mix aswell.

Minecraft Aspect: Blocky.

Cod Aspect: Guns, Fps, etc

ROBLOX Aspect: Roblox is about Building Sharing and Playing aswell, but with less Blockyness and Fps in it.

Free to play, Is it worth it? YES!!! It should be worth some money though for the quality of it, though. Not asking you to make it priced, just saying great quality.

Brick-Force is a PVP FPS with a building with bricks gameplay.  Mainly for kids that cannot play real FPS.  Looks like Lego styled characters.  Very buggy but ran somewhat for me.  Has X-Trap antiHacker sensor.   It is Free to Play, try it maybe you like it, then uninstall.

reviewText: Note: Ignore my hours because i've actually played the non steam version a while back\nNow i see brickforce is on steam right? date: Why? because when i was playing this it was fantastic!\n\nNow back when brick force was in closed beta
recommended: me and my bro got a beta key and go in and it was not pay to win! Daily Drops
hoursPlayed: You could buy weapons through in game cash or by leveling up the same thing with the cosmetics.  We knew this game had a future until the fire nation attacke- I mean

reviewText:
This is a good game, its cartoony, and happy. (Aside from murdering other people that is) but it's just gone downhill after the Steam release, i had Brick-Force before it was on steam and ANYTIME ANYWHERE, Someone was playing what you wanted to play, and now... SOMEONE is playing the game... and thats kinda it. i remember scrolling for 10 SECONDS on the list in the bottom right to get to the bottom of the list of players, now i don't even have to scroll or the final person's name is just cut in 2. Aside from the lack of players, the game is really find, Especially the grinding for that weapon you've wanted ever since you laid eyes on it. So my opinion

Fun 9/10
Popularity 2/10
Cartoony Style 7/10
Fun Gameplay 9/10
Bunch o' Gamemodes 10/10
Total 37/50 = B-

reviewText: The game itself is not bad. I admit the majority of the community has spent a lot of money on the game and the shop is very limited for those who do not spend any money. And there are 2 ways around this. 1.Get together with friends and make a room and just play together, or make rooms and set them up before hand and turn off mid game joining. 2. You are able to compete with the Pay to Wins with stuff from the shop, you just need to get the force points for it. But I do recomend the game.

Holy ♥♥♥♥... I just got this game and OH. MY. GAWG.
This game is so optimised it is AMAZIN!
